content.description: <math alttext="The figure presents a 2 row table with 5 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “y,” and the heading for row 2 is “g of y.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. y is 8. g of y is negative 7. Column 2. y is 9. g of y is 2. Column 3. y is 10. g of y is 4. Column 4. y is 11. g of y is negative 3. Column 5. y is 12. g of y is negative 9." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 3em 3em" equalrows="true" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0.5ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="1ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>y</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>8</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>9</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>10</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>11</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>12</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>9</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: Let <math alttext="y equals, f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> be the solution to the differential equation <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x, equals, 4 x, plus g of y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> with the initial condition <math alttext="f of 1, equals 10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Selected values of <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> are given in the table above. What is the approximation for <math alttext="f of 1.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1.5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> obtained by using Euler’s method with a step size of 0.25 starting at <math alttext="x equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

topic.text: 7.5: (BC ONLY) Approximating Solutions Using Euler's Method

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
